materials.raw_text: B: 40 g, Cd: 16 g, Ni: 48 g, Sn: 8 g, Y: 8 g

sourcing.instructions: B (Boron powder) - Chemical supply stores; Cd (Cadmium powder) - Specialty metal suppliers; Ni (Nickel powder) - Metal supply companies; Sn (Tin powder) - Metal suppliers; Y (Yttrium oxide) - Chemical suppliers.
steps: B (Boron powder) - Chemical supply stores; Cd (Cadmium powder) - Specialty metal suppliers; Ni (Nickel powder) - Metal supply companies; Sn (Tin powder) - Metal suppliers; Y (Yttrium oxide) - Chemical suppliers.

1. Measure out 40 g of boron powder. 2. Measure 16 g of cadmium powder. 3. Measure 48 g of nickel powder. 4. Measure 8 g of tin powder. 5. Measure 8 g of yttrium oxide. 6. Combine all powders in a clean, dry mixing bowl. 7. Use a mortar and pestle to grind the mixture thoroughly for 15 minutes to ensure uniformity.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Measure out 40 g of boron powder. 2. Measure 16 g of cadmium powder. 3. Measure 48 g of nickel powder. 4. Measure 8 g of tin powder. 5. Measure 8 g of yttrium oxide. 6. Combine all powders in a clean, dry mixing bowl. 7. Use a mortar and pestle to grind the mixture thoroughly for 15 minutes to ensure uniformity.

steps: 1. Transfer the mixed powders to a crucible. 2. Place the crucible in a furnace. 3. Heat gradually to 900°C (1652°F) at a rate of 10°C/min. 4. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete reaction.
heating.raw_text: 1. Transfer the mixed powders to a crucible. 2. Place the crucible in a furnace. 3. Heat gradually to 900°C (1652°F) at a rate of 10°C/min. 4. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete reaction.

steps: 1. Turn off the furnace and allow it to cool naturally. 2. Wait until the temperature drops below 300°C (572°F) before removing the crucible, approximately 1-2 hours. 3. Carefully transfer the crucible to a heat-resistant surface to cool to room temperature.
cooling.raw_text: 1. Turn off the furnace and allow it to cool naturally. 2. Wait until the temperature drops below 300°C (572°F) before removing the crucible, approximately 1-2 hours. 3. Carefully transfer the crucible to a heat-resistant surface to cool to room temperature.

steps: 1. Once cooled, remove the solidified material from the crucible. 2. Use a diamond saw to cut the sample into the desired dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. 3. Sand the edges and surfaces using fine-grit sandpaper for a smooth finish. 4. Optionally, apply a sealant to enhance durability and prevent oxidation.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once cooled, remove the solidified material from the crucible. 2. Use a diamond saw to cut the sample into the desired dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. 3. Sand the edges and surfaces using fine-grit sandpaper for a smooth finish. 4. Optionally, apply a sealant to enhance durability and prevent oxidation.
